bibl.title: Callimachus and the Bush in Iamb 4.
bibl.note: Suggest that the bramble bush (in Greek, batos) in Callimachus' fourth Iamb, which tries to make peace between the quarreling olive and laurel trees, stands in for Callimachus himself (or his persona), and echoes the conciliatory posture that Hipponax adopts in the first Iamb. Propose further that the word batos is a pun on Battos, the name of Callimachus' father (Callimachus refers to himself elsewhere as Battiades). - Avec résumé en anglais.
